publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-2187# Cathie Craigie: World Alzheimer's Day-That the Parliament expresses its support for World Alzheimer's Day, held on 21 September every year; recognises its aim of raising global awareness of dementia and its impact on families; notes that around 58,000 people suffer from dementia in Scotland, and further recognises the importance of the work of organisations such as Alzheimer Scotland - Action on Dementia in supporting sufferers and their families. Supported by: Tommy Sheridan*
S1M-2187# World Alzheimer's Day (lodged on 7 September 2001) Patricia Ferguson*, Dr Elaine Murray*, Johann Lamont*, Mr Kenneth Gibson*, Mr Andy Kerr*, Mr Murray Tosh*, Bristow Muldoon*

S1M-2187# World Alzheimer's Day (lodged on 7 September 2001) Elaine Thomson*, David Mundell*, Mrs Lyndsay McIntosh*, Margaret Jamieson*, Helen Eadie*, Roseanna Cunningham*, Christine Grahame*, Brian Fitzpatrick*, Shona Robison*, Michael Matheson*, Alex Neil*, Scott Barrie*, Karen Whitefield*, Tricia Marwick*, Mr Adam Ingram*, Robert Brown*, Mr John McAllion*, Mr Michael McMahon*, Kate MacLean*, Mrs Margaret Ewing*, Robin Harper*, Janis Hughes*

S1M-2187# World Alzheimer's Day (lodged on 7 September 2001) Dr Sylvia Jackson*, Ms Sandra White*, Donald Gorrie*, Mary Scanlon*, Mr Kenneth Macintosh*, Hugh Henry*, Stewart Stevenson*, Elaine Smith*, Michael Russell*, Des McNulty*
S1M-2187# World Alzheimer's Day (lodged on 7 September 2001) Dennis Canavan*, Tavish Scott*, Trish Godman*, Karen Gillon*

S1M-2187# Cathie Craigie: World Alzheimer's Day—That the Parliament expresses its support for World Alzheimer’s Day, held on 21 September every year; recognises its aim of raising global awareness of dementia and its impact on families; notes that around 58,000 people suffer from dementia in Scotland, and further recognises the importance of the work of organisations such as Alzheimer Scotland - Action on Dementia in supporting sufferers and their families. Supported by: Tommy Sheridan, Patricia Ferguson, Dr Elaine Murray, Johann Lamont, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Mr Andy Kerr, Mr Murray Tosh, Bristow Muldoon, Elaine Thomson, David Mundell, Mrs Lyndsay McIntosh, Margaret Jamieson, Helen Eadie, Roseanna Cunningham, Christine Grahame, Brian Fitzpatrick, Shona Robison, Michael Matheson, Alex Neil, Scott Barrie, Karen Whitefield, Tricia Marwick, Mr Adam Ingram, Robert Brown, Mr John McAllion, Mr Michael McMahon, Kate MacLean, Mrs Margaret Ewing, Robin Harper, Janis Hughes, Dr Sylvia Jackson, Ms Sandra White, Donald Gorrie, Mary Scanlon, Mr Kenneth Macintosh, Hugh Henry, Stewart Stevenson, Elaine Smith, Michael Russell, Des McNulty, Dennis Canavan, Tavish Scott, Trish Godman, Karen Gillon, Irene McGugan*, Mrs Mary Mulligan*
S1M-2187# World Alzheimer's Day (lodged on 7 September 2001) Rhoda Grant*, Irene Oldfather*
S1M-2187# World Alzheimer's Day (lodged on 7 September 2001) Dorothy-Grace Elder*
S1M-2187# World Alzheimer's Day (lodged on 7 September 2001) Mr Keith Raffan*
S1M-2187# World Alzheimer's Day (lodged on 7 September 2001) Cathy Peattie*, Mr Gil Paterson*

S1M-2187# Cathie Craigie: World Alzheimer's Day-That the Parliament expresses its support for World Alzheimer's Day, held on 21 September every year; recognises its aim of raising global awareness of dementia and its impact on families; notes that around 58,000 people suffer from dementia in Scotland, and further recognises the importance of the work of organisations such as Alzheimer Scotland - Action on Dementia in supporting sufferers and their families. Supported by: Tommy Sheridan, Patricia Ferguson, Dr Elaine Murray, Johann Lamont, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Mr Andy Kerr, Mr Murray Tosh, Bristow Muldoon, Elaine Thomson, David Mundell, Mrs Lyndsay McIntosh, Margaret Jamieson, Helen Eadie, Roseanna Cunningham, Christine Grahame, Brian Fitzpatrick, Shona Robison, Michael Matheson, Alex Neil, Scott Barrie, Karen Whitefield, Tricia Marwick, Mr Adam Ingram, Robert Brown, Mr John McAllion, Mr Michael McMahon, Kate MacLean, Mrs Margaret Ewing, Robin Harper, Janis Hughes, Dr Sylvia Jackson, Ms Sandra White, Donald Gorrie, Mary Scanlon, Mr Kenneth Macintosh, Hugh Henry, Stewart Stevenson, Elaine Smith, Michael Russell, Des McNulty, Dennis Canavan, Tavish Scott, Trish Godman, Karen Gillon, Irene McGugan, Mrs Mary Mulligan, Rhoda Grant, Irene Oldfather, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Mr Keith Raffan, Cathy Peattie, Mr Gil Paterson, Maureen Macmillan*
S1M-2187# World Alzheimer's Day (lodged on 7 September 2001) Mr Keith Harding*
S1M-2187# World Alzheimer's Day (lodged on 7 September 2001) Cathy Jamieson*, Pauline McNeill*, Mr Jamie Stone*
S1M-2187# World Alzheimer's Day (lodged on 7 September 2001) John Scott*

S1M-2187# Cathie Craigie: World Alzheimer's Day-That the Parliament expresses its support for World Alzheimer's Day, held on 21 September every year; recognises its aim of raising global awareness of dementia and its impact on families; notes that around 58,000 people suffer from dementia in Scotland, and further recognises the importance of the work of organisations such as Alzheimer Scotland - Action on Dementia in supporting sufferers and their families. Supported by: Tommy Sheridan, Patricia Ferguson, Dr Elaine Murray, Johann Lamont, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Mr Andy Kerr, Mr Murray Tosh, Bristow Muldoon, Elaine Thomson, David Mundell, Mrs Lyndsay McIntosh, Margaret Jamieson, Helen Eadie, Roseanna Cunningham, Christine Grahame, Brian Fitzpatrick, Shona Robison, Michael Matheson, Alex Neil, Scott Barrie, Karen Whitefield, Tricia Marwick, Mr Adam Ingram, Robert Brown, Mr John McAllion, Mr Michael McMahon, Kate MacLean, Mrs Margaret Ewing, Robin Harper, Janis Hughes, Dr Sylvia Jackson, Ms Sandra White, Donald Gorrie, Mary Scanlon, Mr Kenneth Macintosh, Hugh Henry, Stewart Stevenson, Elaine Smith, Michael Russell, Des McNulty, Dennis Canavan, Tavish Scott, Trish Godman, Karen Gillon, Irene McGugan, Mrs Mary Mulligan, Rhoda Grant, Irene Oldfather, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Mr Keith Raffan, Cathy Peattie, Mr Gil Paterson, Maureen Macmillan, Mr Keith Harding, Cathy Jamieson, Pauline McNeill, Mr Jamie Stone, John Scott, Fiona McLeod*
